events.originalText: A group broke into the North Korean embassy in Madrid and stole several mobile telephones and digital storage devices.
events.subtitle: North Korean Embassy in Madrid incident
events.headline: North Korean embassy in Madrid broken into, mobile phones and digital devices stolen

events.originalText: A train failed to apply its brakes and crashed through a buffer stop at Once railway station in Buenos Aires, resulting in 51 deaths and more than 700 injuries.
events.subtitle: 2012 Buenos Aires rail disaster
events.headline: Train crash at Once railway station in Buenos Aires leaves 51 dead and over 700 injured

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.3 ML struck Christchurch, New Zealand, killing 185 people and causing around NZ$40 billion in damage.
events.subtitle: 2011 Christchurch earthquake
events.headline: Deadly earthquake in Christchurch, New Zealand claims 185 lives and causes NZ$40 billion in damage

events.originalText: Bahraini uprising: Tens of thousands of people marched in protest in Manama against the deaths of seven people killed by police and army forces during previous protests.
events.subtitle: 2011 Bahraini uprising
events.headline: Mass protest in Manama against deaths in Bahraini uprising

events.originalText: Seven men staged the largest cash robbery in Britain at a Securitas depot in Tonbridge, Kent, United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Securitas depot robbery
events.headline: Largest cash robbery in Britain at Securitas depot in Tonbridge, Kent

events.originalText: Scientists at the Roslin Institute in Scotland announced the existence of Dolly, a female sheep who was the first mammal to have successfully been cloned from an adult cell.
events.subtitle: Roslin Institute
events.headline: Dolly the cloned sheep announced by scientists at Roslin Institute in Scotland

events.originalText: The play Moose Murders opened and closed on the same night at the Eugene O'Neill Theatre, becoming the standard of "awfulness" against which all Broadway failures are judged.
events.subtitle: Moose Murders
events.headline: Broadway play Moose Murders opens and closes on same night at Eugene O'Neill Theatre

events.originalText: At the Winter Olympics in Lake Placid, New York, the United States ice hockey team defeated the Soviet team in an unlikely victory that became known as the Miracle on Ice.
events.subtitle: 1980 Winter Olympics
events.headline: Miracle on Ice: US ice hockey team defeats Soviet team at Winter Olympics in Lake Placid

events.originalText: Lee Petty won the first Daytona 500 NASCAR auto race at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Florida.
events.subtitle: Lee Petty
events.headline: Lee Petty wins first Daytona 500 NASCAR race at Daytona International Speedway

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. forces carried out a bombing raid on the Nazi-occupied Dutch city of Nijmegen, killing hundreds of civilians by accident.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Tragic accidental bombing raid on Nijmegen by US forces during World War II

events.originalText: The Bogd Khan was reinstalled as emperor after White Russian forces under Roman von Ungern-Sternberg (pictured) drove the Chinese out of Mongolia.
events.subtitle: Bogd Khan
events.headline: Bogd Khan reinstated as emperor after White Russian forces drive Chinese out of Mongolia

events.originalText: The sixteen United States Navy battleships of the Great White Fleet, led by Connecticut (pictured), completed a circumnavigation of the globe.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: Great White Fleet completes global circumnavigation led by battleship Connecticut

events.originalText: The Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, Maryland, named after philanthropist Johns Hopkins, opened.
events.subtitle: Johns Hopkins University
events.headline: Johns Hopkins University opens in Baltimore, Maryland

events.originalText: Robert II became King of Scots as the first monarch of the House of Stewart.
events.subtitle: Robert II of Scotland
events.headline: Robert II becomes King of Scots, first monarch of House of Stewart

events.originalText: The Catalan forces of Ferdinand of Majorca defeated troops loyal to Princess Matilda of Hainaut at the Battle of Picotin on the Peloponnese peninsula in modern-day Greece.
events.subtitle: Principality of Catalonia
events.headline: Catalan forces defeat troops at Battle of Picotin on Peloponnese peninsula
